cessda: Consortium of European Social Science Data Archives

notAvailable.heading: The requested data was not found.
notAvailable.content: It may not exist or is not available in the selected language. Choose an alternative language or start a new search.

search: Select a language for optimal search results

noHits.noResultsFound: No results found for "%(query)s" in the selected language.
noHits.error: We're sorry, an issue occurred when fetching your results. Please try again.

topic.label: Topic
topic.tooltip: CESSDA Topic Classification serves to identify the general topics, subjects or themes of a study. Note: Some studies use other topic classifications and are not included in the filter.

collectionDates.label: Collection years
collectionDates.tooltip: The year(s) in which the data for the study were collected.

languageOfDataFiles.label: Language of data files
languageOfDataFiles.tooltip: Language of the research dataset, i.e. the language of the variable names/labels or interview transcriptions etc.

country.label: Country
country.tooltip: The country which the data cover. Note: the filter only includes those studies where the metadata provide an ISO 3166-1 country code. Use an additional free-text search with country name for more results.

langAvailableIn.label: Search language(s)
langAvailableIn.tooltip: Language of study titles and abstract / description.

publisher.label: Publisher
publisher.tooltip: Name of the institution providing the information (metadata) on the study.

summary.label: Filter summary
summary.introduction: The following filters have been applied to your search.
summary.remove: Select a filter to remove it from this search.
summary.noFilters: No additional filters have been applied to your search.

numberOfResults.zero: %(count)s studies found in %(label)s from a total of %(total)s
numberOfResults.one: %(count)s studies found in %(label)s from a total of %(total)s
numberOfResults.other: %(count)s studies found in %(label)s from a total of %(total)s

advancedSearch.label: Search help
advancedSearch.introduction: The following special characters can be used to perform advanced search queries:
advancedSearch.phrase: " wraps a number of tokens to signify a phrase for searching.
advancedSearch.prefix: * at the end of a term signifies a prefix query.
advancedSearch.distance: ~N after a word signifies edit distance (fuzziness).
advancedSearch.slop: ~N after a phrase signifies slop amount.

escaping.heading: Escaping
escaping.content: The above characters are reserved. In order to search for any of these special characters, they will need to be escaped with \.

defaultOperator.heading: Default operator
defaultOperator.content: The default operator when there are no special characters in a given search term is OR. For example when searching for Social Science, this will be interpreted as Social OR Science.

methodology.label: Methodology
methodology.tooltip: Terminology used is generally based on DDI controlled vocabularies: Time Method, Analysis Unit, Sampling Procedure and Mode of Collection, available at <a href="https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/">CESSDA Vocabulary Service<a/>.

topics.label: Topics
topics.tooltip: Many but not all metadata providers use CESSDA Topic Classification for their topic terms.

keywords.label: Keywords
keywords.tooltip: Many but not all metadata providers use ELSST Thesaurus for their keywords.

about.label: About
about.content:
The CESSDA Data Catalogue (CDC) contains descriptions (metadata) of the more than 30,000 data collections held by CESSDA’s Service Providers (SP), representing 20 European countries. It is a one-stop shop for searching and finding data, enabling effective access to European social science data. The data described are varied. They may be quantitative, qualitative or mixed-modes data, cross-sectional or longitudinal, recently collected or historical data.

The User Guide presents an overview of how to use the CDC for searching, including basic search and applying filters as well as advanced search. The CDC is a portal for discovering data. Detailed descriptions of data collections are provided. For information and procedures to access data, there is a link in the lower right of each entry to the website of the data provider [“Access data”].
